posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We‚Äôre releasing the Signal 7.56 beta soon. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

  • Signal Secure Backups! Better release notes coming soon Check out the stuff I‚Äôve written below.

Complete list of new commits since 7.55.0:

https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.55.0‚Ä¶main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

It‚Äôs been a long time coming, but we finally feel comfortable taking all of our work on the new Signal Secure Backups system to beta!

First off ‚Äì thank you so much to everyone who helped out during the alpha testing. As always, your feedback was invaluable! I‚Äôll summarize some key points here, but please read the original post, as it‚Äôll have even more detail.

Note that for the initial phase of this beta, it‚Äôs going to be Github Releases Only. That means you‚Äôll have to follow the instructions here to get it. We want one last round of testing from you guys before we take it to the broader Play Store beta :) Rest assured, it‚Äôs signed with the same key as normal Play Store releases, so you should be able to install over top of a Play Store release without issue.

Ok, with that out of the way ‚Äì backups! For an overview, I‚Äôll quote from the alpha post:

Public Signal Backups Testing

The new backup system fulfills so many of the things people have wanted for so long:

  • Hosted by Signal, so your data is safe even if you made a local backup but dropped your phone in a lake.
  • An independent backup format that is readable by all clients, so that you can do things like backup on Android and restore on iOS.
  • A generous optional free tier that will ensure that all of the text content of your messages is backed up, as well as the most recent 45 days of media.
  • A fairly-priced paid tier that allows us to offer 100GB of media storage in a way that is sustainable for us as an organization.

And of course these things are handled with the utmost care in traditional Signal fashion:

  • Backups are end-to-end encrypted with a strong key that only you have access to.
  • Backups are disabled by default.
  • Backups are structured so that the Signal service cannot associate a backup with a given user.
  • Payments are structured so that the Signal service cannot associate a payment with a given user.

You can enable backups via Settings > Backups. If you have any detailed questions, I‚Äôm happy to answer them!

One thing you may have questions about is that the feature has a little ‚ÄúBeta‚Äù label inside the app. This is intentional, and it may take us a while to get out of this phase. What does the label mean? It means that there are still some edge cases we‚Äôre working through, some more testing we want to happen, and some more features (like Optimized Storage) that we want to finish before we‚Äôre comfortable removing that label. It may take months for us to remove this label, but hopefully it won‚Äôt turn into a gmail situation ;)

But the feature works! Over the past 8 or 9 years, I‚Äôve accrued over 500k messages and ~45GiB of media, and I‚Äôve done multiple full backup and restores of my device using the new system without issue. That said, we are gonna use that ‚ÄúBeta‚Äù label as a bit of a shield ‚Äì there may be quirks that we weren‚Äôt aware of, and we hope you‚Äôll help us find them :)

Even during the beta, backups do cost money. It‚Äôs $2/mo. Storage is expensive, and because Signal doesn‚Äôt monetize user data, we have to charge to provide the service. But even with its Beta labeling, we believe the feature is worth the money :)

Again, happy to answer any questions, and enjoy!

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.56.0 (158000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

46 new commits since 7.55.0:

Show commits

  • Ensure that all SignalValues are having the correct overrides called. [1]

  • Remove set pin after aep reg megaphone. [2]

  • Fix received stickers for installed packs without a data_hash_end. [3]

  • Small JobManager tweaks to scale more often and improve debugging info. [4]

  • Add additional information to entitlement level log-line of context job. [5]

  • Fix name of thread dump log sections. [6]

  • Use more sensible numberings for JobRunner ids. [7]

  • Ensure that memory-only jobs do not get lost due to cache eviction. [8]

  • Set remote fetch time for remote config v2. [9]

  • Do not prompt prod users to enable backups. [10]

  • Catch foreground service not allowed exceptions. [11]

  • Add backstop for ensuring attachment archive jobs are enqueued. [12]

  • Generate thumbnails for quote attachments. [13]

  • Do not generate archive thumbnails for quotes. [14]

  • Add a migration to generate thumbnails for existing quotes. [15]

  • Migrate quotes to have a separate quoteTargetContentType. [16]

  • Improve quote deletion, remove file deletes from transactions. [17]

  • Add quote reconstruction job for free-tier restores. [18]

  • Update backup related strings. [19]

  • Only allow archive tier overrides on staging. [20]

  • Clear some tooltips after restore, remove some legacy ones entirely. [21]

  • Add backupVersion to RegistrationProvisioning.proto [22]

  • Bump libsignal to v0.79.1 [23]

  • Remove backup frequency setting. [24]

  • Limit quote bodies to 2kib on export. [25]

  • Fix several backup related problems. [26]

  • Show 'calculating' while loading backup size. [27]

  • Ensure we don't archive thumbnails or stories. [28]

  • Improve archive restore progress tracking and UX. [29]

  • Disable the 'optimize storage' feature for production users. [30]

  • Update various registration related logs as keep-longer. [31]

  • Do not include view-once or long text in the media snapshot table. [32]

  • Fix thumbnail job precondition. [33]

  • Add logging when registration can't be completed. [34] (reverted by [44])

  • Add separate column to track archive thumbnail status. [35]

  • Call mark registration complete in more places. [36]

  • Handle thumbnail generation failing more gracefully. [37]

  • Add failsafe for clearing abandoned backup progress. [38]

  • Fix possible crash during restore. [39]

  • Enable Signal Secure Backups for external users. [40]

  • Fix wallpaper attachments not being restored. [41]

  • Add run restore media job to internal settings. [42]

  • Disable saving PIN to password manager. [43]

    We haven't found a reliable way to make the auto-fill framework differentiate between the PIN and backup key, so we are disabling prompts to save Signal PINs to password managers to avoid accidentally overwriting a saved backup key with a PIN value.

  • Revert "Add logging when registration can't be completed." [44] (reverts [34])

  • Update translations and other static files. [45]

  • Bump version to 7.56.0 [46]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.55.0‚Ä¶v7.56.0

Should the paid option be available already? I only see free.

Log

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.56.0/3f70074a53fdb770e60b18e2d9be589469ae3a6d016c897ae4f5804715110633

I just have a question. How would backups work, when there are multiple devices in the future?
Like for example, my case.
I have Android and macOS apps. macOS has some messages that Android doesn‚Äôt have from earlier and there are also some messages that Android has but macOS doesn‚Äôt have. Will the system combine messages from both systems into one database?

posts.cooked:
History sync across devices was rolled out to production in February:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.33 release Android Beta Feedback
We‚Äôre releasing the Signal 7.33 beta soon. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group here . If you‚Äôd like to get releases even faster, try out Obtainium! Share your feedback on the latest changes: ‚òÖ Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave t‚Ä¶

posts.cooked:
Thank you for all the amazing work!

Now to the testbeds‚Ä¶

I enabled backups, it ran a backup saying it was processing 16.8MB. Then it indicated the backup was completed. However, surely my last 30 days of media isn‚Äôt included in this 16.8MB, right? Is this happening in the background?
There was a message that it might take a long time, but if it is happening in the background, there is no indication to that fact.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
I think in the other thread he said what you‚Äôd see listed is the compressed size.

Edit: In my alpha build my total backup size when using the paid tier is 300MB. On the free tier, the total is 17KB, so your ~17MB must be the compressed size of the last 30 days.

My beta build cloud backup is 7MB, and that‚Äôs almost entirely from one conversation where we trade a ton of GIFs and images on a daily basis.

Edit 2: I just sent six new GIFs and the cloud backup size in my beta build is still the same as before.

I didn‚Äôt mean the history sync across devices but specifically backup. How backups will work with multiple devices, specifically whether messages from both my Android and macOS devices will be combined into one unified database during the backup process?

posts.name: Chloe
posts.cooked: Your phone will create & maintain the backup in the cloud. You‚Äôll have to wait for backup export to come to desktop (if it ever does, I don‚Äôt know if it is just testing for the cloud backup support). Signal is not currently adding the ability to merge incomplete histories from other devices.

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

Should the paid option be available already? I only see free.

It should be! It‚Äôs working on my test devices. Looking at your log, it appears that the device doesn‚Äôt have access to Google Play Billing? Is that expected? We‚Äôre getting back error code 3, which you can see the cause of here: link. Do any of those apply to you?

dgsYnqH3:

I just have a question. How would backups work, when there are multiple devices in the future?

Your primary device will be responsible for making regular backups. We do have a feature planned down the road to ‚Äúbootstrap‚Äù a primary device via a backup made on a linked device, but that isn‚Äôt part of the initial launch.

If your devices have a diverging history, you can delete the linked device and then re-link it, which will seed it with all the data from your primary. If you have data that is exclusive to the linked device, we currently don‚Äôt have any way to merge it with another device‚Äôs history.

DonDino:

However, surely my last 30 days of media isn‚Äôt included in this 16.8MB, right?

So the whole ‚Äú30 days of media‚Äù is a bit of a fun trick in that you don‚Äôt actually need to upload it. We can easily offer 30 days of media because we‚Äôre actually already storing it today! If I send you a message with a photo attached, the service needs to keep that photo (encrypted) on a server somewhere so that you can retrieve it later. We don‚Äôt know how many times it‚Äôll be downloaded (you could have X linked devices, or send it to a group with Y members), so instead we just pick a time threshold (in this case, 30 days) and hold onto it until then.

So no, the 16.8MB is just your message history + metadata. You have much more media, but it‚Äôs already uploaded, and then we just re-download it on restore :)

Avitus:

I just sent six new GIFs and the cloud backup size in my beta build is still the same as before.

Yep, see above ‚Äì it doesn‚Äôt make your backup any larger :)

greyson-signal:

It should be! It‚Äôs working on my test devices. Looking at your log, it appears that the device doesn‚Äôt have access to Google Play Billing? Is that expected? We‚Äôre getting back error code 3, which you can see the cause of here: link. Do any of those apply to you?

That‚Äôs very strange!

The Play Store app on the user‚Äôs device is out of date.

Play Store says I‚Äôm on the current version when I tap ‚Äúupdate Play Store‚Äù in the settings.

The user is in an unsupported country.

Not applicable.

The user is an enterprise user, and their enterprise admin has disabled users from making purchases.

Not applicable. My personal phone is a managed device, but this Signal install is outside of the work profile. I bought dinner with Google Pay/Wallet today, and my Signal donation for August processed successfully with Google Pay/Wallet (September donation in a few days).

Google Play is unable to charge the user‚Äôs payment method. For example, the user‚Äôs credit card might have expired.

The card for my Signal donations is still valid for another four years. I just used it today to pay for dinner, and another unrelated expense.

I‚Äôd totally forgotten about this. Thanks!

posts.name: Clayton Burns
posts.cooked:
@greyson-signal

Same here, only free, installed from GitHub via Obtanium, location is US, stock Pixel 9 Pro Fold.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.56.0/81ebc2c2a1e0fa58ffaf72ee07abb666a01d664f1051f2c5197a1d0187ca1964

I‚Äôm not getting the paid option too

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.56.0/e21284dd2963b53269203e56cec7344d044ae6464c88859f0bd6fc4f4c4ff195

When using WebSocket for notifications, the WebSocket connection breaks if the internet connection temporarly drops. Once an internet connection is restored, the WebSocket connection stays broken until signal is opened manually. It would be better if Signal periodicaly checked if the Websocket is still up and and if not it should automaticaly restore it.

I dont have a debug log right now, but the issue is persistent and easily reproduceble.

Battery optimisation is off.

For the on device backups you click the text. Shouldn‚Äôt it be the same way?

Personally I don‚Äôt really like the design of the view settings bubble thing. I know it‚Äôs aligned properly but it still looks misaligned with the text above

Maybe an arrow sign to the right of the text and then have the whole text block be clickable?

It would also be cool to see how much storage is used for media and how much for messages
